title: Senior Software Engineer | Hybrid | Bangalore
content:
Education: B Tech in IT
Years of Experience: 4.5
Prior Experience: Senior Software Engineer at seed funded startup
Date of the Offer: 12 Jan 2024
Company: Stealth Startup (Series A)
Title/Level: Senior Software Engineer / L4
Location: Bangalore / Hybrid
Salary: Rs 30,00,000
Relocation/Signing Bonus: -
Stock bonus: $40,000 over 4 years
Bonus: No target bonus
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): Rs 38,00,000 per year
Benefits: Great insurance, professional development allowance, flexible work hours, catered meals at office, 18 vacation days + 12 sick leave + 12 casual leaves, other standard stuff. 
Other details: Work from office 1 week every 2 months. Company covers round trip flight tickets to Bangalore from anywhere in India and hotel. Option to switch to 4 day work week if I work from office 100% of the time.


Retention offer at current company : Rs 44,00,000 TC (36 base + 8 equity) and a one time Rs 5,00,000 retention bonus (to be returned if I resign in <12 months). Current org mandates working from office 3 days a week.

title: QuillBot | Senior Software Engineer | Remote
content:
Education: B.Tech CS from Tier-1 college
Years of Experience: 7
Prior Experience: FAANG
Date of the Offer: May 2023
Company: QuillBot
Title/Level: Senior Software Engineer
Location: Remote (Office in Jaipur and Awfis option too)
Base Salary: 60LPA
Signing Bonus: 2 lakhs (To be returned if left within a year)
Stock bonus: 1500 units / 4 years
Annual Bonus: 10% of Base Salary
Total comp (Salary + Bonus + Stock): 68LPA + ~11LPA worth non-IPO'd stock units

**Note 1 -** Above stock valuation is based on the price quoted by HR i.e. $36.55.
However, the current secondary market price is only $19.45 as stated at https://notice.co/c/learneo

**Note 2 -** After spending some time there, it felt like 2x work and lesser compensation (not considering any value of non-IPO'ed RSUs) as compared to my previous company. I don't see any value of fully remote if I can't enjoy my life, so leaving it too for an MNC with hybrid-office, higher compensation and good WLB reputation.
